text.title: Chibougamau
text.author: Wikivoyage community (see URL)
text.head: Chibougamau
text.p: Chibougamau, population 7500 (2011), is the largest regional centre in Northern Quebec. It was founded as a mining village in 1950, and was incorporated as a municipality in 1954.
text.head: History
text.p: The area has long been part of the Cree First Nation (Aboriginal) territory. It was in the early 17th century that French explorers and traders, including Charles Albanel in 1671, came to the Lake Chibougamau area. However, no permanent European settlements were established at that time.

In the late 19th century, the area attracted the interest of mining prospectors. When gold was discovered in 1903, there were periods of intense exploration. Due to difficulty of access, no lasting development took place until 1949 when copper was exploited, with the opening of a multi-metallic mine in the area. A permanent community was established in 1952. Chibougamau started out as a company town but soon after, in 1954, it was incorporated as a municipality. Many mines have exploited the area since. While still thought of as a mining town, Chibougamau is now also the centre of a large logging and sawmill industry.
text.head: By car
text.p: From southern Québec, the general route to Chibougamau-Chapais is Route 167 from Lac St-Jean, from where it is possible to travel to Trois-Rivières via Shawinigan and Roberval on Route 155. Western Québec and Ontario are connected to Chibougamau by Route 113, connecting to Route 117 at Louvicourt near Val-d'Or. Both routes are paved and have a speed limit of 90 km/h.
The North Road (Route du Nord), an isolated gravel road, connects Chibougamau to the James Bay Road (Route de la Baie-James).
text.head: By bus

list.item: Intercar, 501 4ième rue (one block south of Hôtel Chibougamau), ☏ +1 418-547-2167 , toll-free: +1-800-806-2167 , fax: +1 418-547-0923 . Intercar (2249, rue St-Hubert, Jonquière) operates a bus service to Chibougamau. Their buses are available through most of the province, including Quebec City (7-7½ hours, $100) and the Saguenay region.

text.head: By plane

list.item: Chibougamau/Chapais Airport ( YMT ) (midway between Chibougamau and Chapais along Route 113, 18 km southwest of Chibougamau), ☏ +1 418-748-3764 . Daily flights with Air Creebec from Montréal-Dorval (except Saturday).

text.head: Get around
text.p: There is no public transport in Chibougamau. There are two local taxi services on 3rd Street:

list.item: Taxi Diamond, 473 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-7725 .
Taxi Coop, 557 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-7651 .

text.head: See

list.item: Mining Discovery Centre (Centre d'intérêt minier de Chibougamau), 924 Route 167 nord, ☏ +1 418-748-4209 . Museum in former Bruneau mine covering mining history from the ancient Pharaohs' search for gold to modern times, plus a guided tour of the mine.

Cree communities: Chibougamau is the largest regional centre to visit the aboriginal Cree communities of Oujé-Bougoumou (47 km west) and Mistissini (86 km north). Oujé-Bougoumou was designed by renowned Canadian architect Douglas Cardinal, who designed the Museum of Civilization in Gatineau, Québec, and has received UNESCO recognition as a model community due to sustainable development practices and cultural preservation.
Wildlife abounds. Bears are sometimes visible at the municipal dump.

text.head: Do

list.item: Festival Folifrets. Chibougamau celebrates the winter. Ten days at the end of Feb to mid-March. Antique snowmobile rally, endurance run.

Centre de plein air du Mont Chalco, 264 route 167, ☏ +1 418-748-7162 . Snowboarding, ski rental, 11 slopes, a triple chairlift, a tube run, snowblades, 29 km (18 mi) of cross-country ski trails and a snowshoe trail.

Club de Golf de Chibougamau, 130, rue des Forces-Armées, ☏ +1 418-748-4709 , ✉ golfchibougamau@hotmail.com . Nine-hole golf course, golf cart, club and ball rental, restaurant, conference facilities. Mid-May to mid-Sept.
Escapade Boréale, 1252 route 167, Chapais, ☏ +1 418-770-8351 . Tent, canoe and parasail rental.
Paraski Boréal, ☏ +1 418-770-8342 , ✉ paraskiboreal@hotmail.com . Kite skiing. Paraski Flex and IKO instruction and equipment.
Lake Gilman. Walking, biking and fishing.
Mini-Golf, 651, 3e Rue, ☏ +1 418-748-2225 . 18 holes. Chess club “Les fous de la tour de glace” on-site.

Pourvoirie Chibougamau, Lac Laganière, route 167 Nord, La Doré (8 km N of Chibougamau), ☏ +1 418 630-6898 . Outfitter and fishing camp with 2-6 person cottages (kitchen, running water, propane, patio, shower, BBQ).
Salle de quilles Bolorama, 160, avenue Lafontaine, ☏ +1 418-748-7286 , toll-free: +1-877-420-5996 . Eight-lane bowling alley. from $10.
Snowmobile trails lead across the province, from Rouyn-Noranda through Chibougamau to the Saguenay.

text.head: Drink
text.p: All of the below bars are on 3e rue.

list.item: Le Gwillim, 560 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-7533 . Popular local nightclub that attracts a very young crowd, impressive selection of shooters.
La Ptite Broue, 535 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-4848 . Another fairly popular pub that attracts a good crowd on weekends.
Pub Royal, 502 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-3643 . Popular local bar/sports bar/pub, with music weekend nights, serving a wide variety of imported and local beers, liqueurs, absinthe, and various dishes.
Le Rendez-Vous at the Hôtel Chibougamau typically attracts a large aboriginal crowd. Pool table and gaming machines.
Le CabArrêt is the local strip club.

text.head: Sleep
text.p: All of the following accommodations are located on 3e rue (Route 167):

list.item: Éco-Camping (municipal campground), 512 Route 167 Sud, ☏ +1 418-748-7276 , fax: +1 418-748-1110 . Mid-May to Labour Day, 42 campsites for tents and RVs on Lac Sauvage, sports field and equipment, playground, Wi-Fi, wood, showers, laundry, bicycle rental. Pet-friendly. Just outside the city on Route 167.

Motel Nordic, 966 3ième rue, ☏ +1 418-748-7686 , toll-free: +1-888-748-6673 , fax: +1 418-748-6538 . 52 rooms, a/c, dvd, wi-fi, refrigerators. Resto-Bistro Roméo et Juliette.

Hôtel Chibougamau, 473, 3e rue, ☏ +1 418-748-2669 , fax: +1 418-748-2107 . Large hotel in centre of town with Internet, video, minibar, laundry, meeting facilities, «Le Bon Accueil» restaurant, «Le Rendez-vous» and «La Tourelle» bars.
